intro: Anneslia izalcoensis, commonly known as the Izalco anneslia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its delicate, blue-violet petals and compact growth habit. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
